text: The Peugeot 406 is a mid-size car that was produced by the French manufacturer Peugeot between 1995 and 2004. It succeeded the Peugeot 405. The 406 was known for its elegant design, comfortable interior, and advanced features for its time. It was produced in several body styles, including a 4-door saloon (sedan), an 5-door estate, and in 1997 it was launched a 2-door coupe that was designed in collaboration with Italian design house Pininfarina. The car underwent a facelift in 1999 to refresh its appearance and improve its performance, before being replaced by the Peugeot 407 in 2004. . == Engines == === Petrol === * 1.6 65 kW (88 hp) * 1.8 66 kW (90 hp) * 1.8 16V 81 kW (110 hp) and 85 kW (115 hp) * 2.0 16V 97 kW (132 hp), 99 kW (135 hp) and 100 kW (136 hp) * 2.0 Turbo 108 kW (147 hp) * 2.2 16V 116 kW (158 hp) * 3.0 V6 140 kW (190 hp) and 152 kW (207 hp) === Diesel === * 1.9 SD 55 kW (75 hp) * 1.9 TD 66 kW (90 hp) * 2.0 HDi 66 kW (90 hp), 79 kW (107 hp) and 80 kW (109 hp) * 2.1 TD 80 kW (109 hp) * 2.2 HDi 98 kW (136 hp) 406 Category:1990s automobiles Category:2000s automobiles
